title: Starving in the Motte
author: Not specified in the provided text.
date_published: Not specified in the provided text.
dek: The "motte-and-bailey fallacy" is useful for identifying weak arguments, but overly cautious adherence to only defensible claims ("the motte") stifles progress.  The author argues that venturing into less certain territory ("the bailey") is crucial for scientific advancement, even if it means being vulnerable to criticism.  Progress requires navigating the uncertain, accepting provisional claims, and refining them over time.
